title: Ticket #6568: Startd always kills jobs after 40 minutes (job lease not renewed)
description:
Normally, the startd will renew the job lease automatically while the starter is alive (see #4491). However, due to startd code refactoring to fix #6524, the startd will no longer do this by default. Seems like the startd is now confusing the activation ad for the claim ad? The result is the job gets killed after job_lease_duration seconds (which defaults to 40 minutes).

To reproduce, submit a job like so (note short job_lease_duration): 

   executable = /bin/sleep
   arguments = 300
   job_lease_duration = 20
   queue

And then in the StarterLog you will see the following (note lease expires 20 seconds after going into activity Busy): 

   02/13/18 13:47:27 slot1: Changing activity: Idle -> Busy
   02/13/18 13:47:47 slot1: State change: claim lease expired (condor_schedd gone?), evicting claim
   02/13/18 13:47:47 slot1: Changing state and activity: Claimed/Busy -> Preempting/Killing
   02/13/18 13:47:47 slot1: Got DEACTIVATE_CLAIM while in Preempting state, ignoring.
   02/13/18 13:47:47 Starter pid 5612 exited with status 0

The problem here is that the changes in #6524 switched from using the job ad passed from schedd at claim time to using the job ad passed from the shadow at activation time when it was deciding how to setup the keepalive behavior. This is controlled by the SCHEDD via attributes ATTR_STARTD_SENDS_ALIVES and ATTR_STARTER_HANDLES_ALIVES, and these attributes are not set in the job ad that the shadow sees and subsequently sends to the startd at activation time.
